data.title: London Blackfriars Station, Tickets & Information
data.meta_description: Grand Central Rail has all the information you need about London Blackfriars station, including its ticketing services and location. Find out more here.
data.text:
Standalone QTT

London Blackfriars Train Station

What are London Blackfriars train station's opening hours?

London Blackfriars station opening hours are:

no information

Saturday - 07:15 to 20:00

Sunday - 08:00 to 16:00

Impaired Access Helpline Hours Monday - Sunday - open 24h

Impaired Access Staff Help Hours Monday - Sunday - open 24h

Accesible Ticket Machine

All Thameslink ticket machines are able to sell tickets with Disabled Persons Railcard discounts. Ticket machines are of an accessible design, however their location and the station itself may not be so please check the station access note for further details

Customer Help Point Passengers can ask for assistance either at the ticket office, or at the platform office on 3/4 which is manned 24 hours.

Helpline YES Yes

Helpline Contact Details

If you require assistance on your journey, please contact our assisted travel helpline to discuss your requirements on: Email - [email protected] | Phone - 0800 058 2844 | Textphone - 0800 138 1018

Helpline Contact URL https://www.nationalrail.co.uk/

Impared Mobility Set Down

There is access to the station through the common entrance on Queen Victoria street. There is no dedicated parking but there is a taxi rank.

Step Free Access

This is a Category A station: This station has step-free access to all platforms.

Assistance Meeting Point is the Ticket Office.

Coverage: whole Station

Step Free Access Coverage Whole Station

Staff Help

This station has level access between train and platform without assistance from staff.

Helpline Open Note

The assisted helpline is not available on Christmas Day.

Alternative Station Code

National Location Code BFR

Sixteen Character Name LONDONBLKFRIARS

Baggage Services

Left Luggage: Available No

Left Luggage: URL https://www.nationalrail.co.uk/

Location

Station entrance Northbank side.

Note

Cycles are left at owners risk. Abandoned cycles may be removed

Oyster Notes

Oyster top-up is only available from the self-service ticket machine. Oyster Cards cannot be purchased at this station.

Live train arrival and departures

Get real time updates and information for train departures and arrival times. These updates are provided by National Rail Enquires, using the latest information from across the rail network.
